thesis.summary: Elliott Management (Tier-1, $1B+ stake, ~4% ownership) pushing for CEO replacement following Calvin McDonald's departure (Jan 31, 2026). Jane Nielsen (former Ralph Lauren CFO/COO) proposed as CEO candidate with proven brand turnaround track record. Stock down -47.66% in 2025 creates compelling entry point. Market underpricing successful turnaround value.
thesis.catalyst: CEO replacement with Jane Nielsen or equivalent high-caliber candidate

adjustments.reason: Elliott Management Tier-1 activist, 83% historical success rate

decision.rationale: Score 10.5 significantly exceeds BUY threshold of 8.25. High-conviction activist setup with Tier-1 sponsor (Elliott Management), clear value creation path (CEO upgrade via Jane Nielsen), stock at multi-year lows (-47.66% in 2025). Exceptional financial health (Z-Score 7.88). McDonald departure Jan 31 creates near-term inflection point.

hard_exit_triggers.description: First sign of campaign trouble (Elliott withdraws, proxy fight fails, etc.)
Elliott withdraws campaign, Nielsen declines candidacy, or board installs weak CEO
Poison pill, anti-activist measures, or settlement without Nielsen

hard_exit_triggers.action: EXIT to limit loss to 2% of portfolio

positive_catalysts.action: Hold, likely exit 50% on announcement, let remainder run on operational turnaround
Evaluate candidate quality, likely exit 50% and reassess

positive_catalysts.event: Elliott increases stake or adds board seats

monitoring.notes: Same-day entry monitoring. Price unchanged at entry $212.20. Media signal TRIGGERED: Extensive mainstream coverage (CNBC 'How activist Elliott can help reinvigorate athleisure giant', Yahoo Finance, WWD, Retail Dive, Seeking Alpha, Globe and Mail, FinancialContent) on Elliott $1B+ stake and Jane Nielsen CEO candidacy. Weighted sum 1.0 < 2.0 threshold (no exit required). Below 200-day MA ($212.20 < $218.81) = DEFENSIVE posture recommended but position just opened. McDonald departing Jan 31 (18 days). Elliott campaign progressing as expected with strong media engagement. Q4 guidance raised to high end of range following strong holiday sales (positive operational signal). Data sources: Yahoo Finance (price, 200-MA), web search (media).

Price down -3.9% from entry at $203.91, well above $140.77 stop. Media signal TRIGGERED: Heavy mainstream coverage (CNBC, Yahoo Finance, Business of Fashion, Seeking Alpha) on Elliott $1B+ stake and Jane Nielsen CEO candidacy. Below 200-day MA ($203.91 < $217.96) = DEFENSIVE posture. Weighted sum 1.0 < 2.0 threshold (no exit required). McDonald departure Jan 31 (16 days away). Elliott campaign progressing. No thesis breaks detected. Data sources: IBKR Paper (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).
Price ~203.34. Media signal active. Thesis intact. Holding.

Price $202.20 (-4.7% from entry). Below 200-day MA ($202.20 < $217.57) = DEFENSIVE posture. Media signal not checked (manual search required). IV data unavailable. No thesis breaks or cockroaches detected. Data sources: IBKR Paper (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA).

Price $202.20 (-4.7% from entry), stable from Friday. Media signal TRIGGERED: Continued mainstream coverage (CNBC, Yahoo Finance, Business of Fashion, Retail Dive) on Elliott $1B+ stake and Jane Nielsen CEO candidacy. Founder Chip Wilson also nominated 3 directors for 2026 annual meeting (Marc Maurer ex-On CEO, Laura Gentile ex-ESPN CMO, Eric Hirshberg ex-Activision CEO), adding activist pressure. Below 200-day MA ($202.20 < $217.57) = DEFENSIVE posture. Weighted sum 1.0 < 2.0 threshold (no exit required). McDonald departure Jan 31 (12 days away). Dual activist pressure (Elliott + Chip Wilson) increases pressure on board. No thesis breaks or cockroaches detected. Data sources: IBKR Paper (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).

No thesis breaks or cockroaches detected. WARN Act check unavailable (script command missing). Data sources: Stooq (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA).

Price $188.86 (-11.0% from entry), well above $140.77 stop. Below 200-day MA ($188.86 < $217.10) = DEFENSIVE posture. Media signal TRIGGERED: Heavy mainstream coverage (CNBC, Yahoo Finance, Business of Fashion, GlobalNews) on Elliott $1B+ stake and Jane Nielsen CEO candidacy. Chip Wilson nominated 3 directors (Marc Maurer, Laura Gentile, Eric Hirshberg) adding dual activist pressure. Weighted sum 1.0 < 2.0 threshold. McDonald departure Jan 31 (11 days away). Thesis intact - dual activist pressure (Elliott + Wilson) increasing. Data sources: Stooq (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).

Media signal TRIGGERED: Extensive mainstream coverage (CNBC, Retail Dive, Yahoo Finance, WWD, Seeking Alpha) on Elliott $1B+ stake and Jane Nielsen CEO candidacy. Chip Wilson nominated 3 directors for 2026 annual meeting adding dual activist pressure. McDonald stepping down Jan 31 (10 days away). Weighted sum 1.0 < 2.0 threshold. Thesis intact - dual Tier-1 activist pressure (Elliott + Wilson) on board continues to build. Data sources: Stooq (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA), web search (media).

Price $191.90 (-9.6% from entry), well above $140.77 stop. Below 200-day MA ($191.90 < $216.07) = DEFENSIVE posture. Media signal not checked (manual search required). IV data unavailable. No thesis breaks or cockroaches detected. Data sources: IBKR Paper (price), Yahoo Finance (200-MA).

metadata.notes: Elliott Management Tier-1 activist campaign. McDonald departing Jan 31, 2026. Jane Nielsen (Ralph Lauren turnaround specialist) proposed as CEO candidate. Stock -47.66% in 2025 from $423.32 to $212.20. Trading at 14.23 P/E vs historical premium multiples.
